page.description:
Assign a handler script for the connection to override the default behavior of some or all of the event functions below: Note: Syntax generation functions return true if a statement has been created and false if it has not. Examples:
GenerateAddUserStatement as L (UserName as C, Statement BYREF AS C)
GenerateSelectStatement as L (TableInfo as SQL::TableInfo, Statement BYREF AS C)
page.original:
SQL::Connection::SetSyntaxHandlerScript() Syntax .SetSyntaxHandlerScript( ScriptSource as C ) ArgumentDescription A SQL::Connection object. ScriptSource
Description The SetSyntaxHandlerScript() method assigns a handler script for the connection to override the default behavior of some or all of the event functions. This is an advanced topic. Limitations Examples
See Also SQL::Connection Object
